meanings.sent1: She felt privileged to have a front-row seat at the concert.
meanings.sent2: The privileged students were allowed to leave class early for the field trip.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked quite privileged lounging on the luxurious velvet sofa.
meanings.sent4: The rare golden flower seemed privileged among the ordinary daisies.
meanings.sent5: The princess lived a privileged life in the grand castle.

meanings.definition: A special right, advantage, or immunity granted or available only to a particular person or group.
meanings.sent1: The country club membership was a privileged few could afford.
meanings.sent2: The privileged of free parking was reserved for the VIP guests.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to think it had the privileged to all the nuts in the park.
meanings.sent4: The ancient artifact held a privileged status in the museum's collection.
meanings.sent5: The key to the treasure chest was a privileged only the chosen one possessed.
